alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:12AM MDT until October 02 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK AND CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 212 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have ended over the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The heaviest rainfall has occurred from just north of El Porvenir toward Tierra Monte and the eastern edge of the burn scar. Runoff will continue, therefore, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek and Gallinas River drainage areas. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... El Porvenir, Tierra Monte, Sapello, Montezuma, Gallinas, Rociada, Manuelitas, Mineral Hill, South Carmen and San Geronimo. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 10 and 22...and near Mile Marker 24. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 7 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 7. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages. This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety.
